intro: Pavetta indica var. mollis, commonly known as velvet pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The fruit is a small, three-lobed berry that contains several seeds.
